column4: i understand your frustration. let me see if I can figure out why it's ignoring that particular combo
go to System > Preferences > Appearance > Interface tab and check the "editable menu shortcut keys" box
and let me know when you're ready for the next step
okay. open up three tabs and select the center one (this is so the forward and backward tab menu options light up in the Tabs menu)
sorry, three tabs in a file browser window
this is where it gets weird. open the Tabs menu and hover the mouse over the shortcut key combo you wish to change. then just hit the new combination on the keyboard, and it should change.
what was the keystroke combo you wanted to set?
ctrl + tab forward, ctrl + shift + tab backward.
huh, that's weird. ctrl+tab doesn't work -- but all manner of other shortcuts do :(
It works for other key combinations. I am not allowed to use tab...
Shit like this that makes me give up on ubuntu every time I try to switch.

Okay. I am going to be eating dinner so you can type full instructions here and I will get to them when I get back. If something happens to our connection, I just msg you my email address you can reach me by. Thanks.
